page.title: 11FARMING-ARMTHORPE AREA
page.content: In this area the{majority of farming is done by two farmers,one a private owner and the other a manager.The farming is{highly mechanised}so there is only a small workforce,which is supplemented by casual labour when required. The farms have an{average size}of 360 acres.Approximately 400 acres have been lost to farming due to{tipping } of waste from the local colliery.In some parts the land has dropped as much as 3'due to the mining in the area. The farming is predominantly arable. The{crops}are grown in a mixture of sandy and loam soils and consist of wheat,barley,potatoes,peas and sugar beet.This type of farming has been chosen purely for economic reasons. Farmers have not noticed any changes in animal & plant life in the area.
